data.title: Ventura County FC
data.meta_description: The latest news, scores, highlights and stats from the Ventura County FC in MLS NEXT Pro.
data.text:
LOS ANGELESÂ (Sunday, July 16, 2023)Â â Playing in their ninth home match of the 2023 MLS NEXT Pro campaign, LAÂ GalaxyÂ IIÂ earned a 1-1 draw in regulation and defeated the Tacoma Defiance 4-3 in a penalty-kick shootout at Dignity Health Sports Parkâs Track & Field Stadium on Sunday night. Jonathan PÃ©rez recorded his first goal of the season as LA extended its unbeaten run to four matches dating back to June 29.Â

LAÂ GalaxyÂ IIÂ Run of Form

With the penalty-kick shootout win over Tacoma, LAÂ GalaxyÂ IIÂ improved to 2-0-2 (8 GF, 6 GA) in their last four regular-season matches played dating back to June 29. During the four-match unbeaten run, Aaron Bibout has recorded two goals and three assists. In their last five home matches played dating back to May 21, LAÂ GalaxyÂ IIhold an unbeaten record of 3-0-2 (10 GF, 6 GA).**

Penalty-Kick Shootouts

**In their fifth penalty-kick shootout in MLS NEXT Pro during the 2023 campaign, LAÂ GalaxyÂ IIÂ defeated the Defiance 4-3. LAÂ GalaxyÂ IIÂ have three penalty-kick shootouts this season, while losing twice during the 2023 campaign.

LAÂ GalaxyÂ Academy

Eight LAÂ GalaxyÂ Academy products started in the match against Tacoma: Allan Legaspi, Carson Klein, Riley Dalgado, Marcus Ferkranus, AdriÃ¡n GonzÃ¡lez, Adam SaldaÃ±a, Alex AlcalÃ¡ and Jonathan PÃ©rez. Two LAÂ GalaxyAcademy products appeared off the bench in the penalty-kick shootout win over the Defiance: Diego LÃ³pez and Nicolas Schelotto.Â

Goal-Scoring Plays

LA â Jonathan PÃ©rez (Aaron Bibout), 11th minute:Â Novak MiÄoviÄ played a long ball just past the midfield line to Aaron Bibout, who chested the ball down and dribbled up the field before finding Jonathan PÃ©rez out wide on the right flank. PÃ©rez dribbled towards goal, cutting onto his left foot before firing his low shot from the right side of the penalty area past the Tacoma goalkeeper at the near post.Â

TAC â Dylan Teves (Raul Miglietti), 55th minute:Â Dylan Teves received the ball just on the edge of the 18-yard box and dribbled towards goal, placing his shot just inside the bottom right corner of the goal.Â

Postgame Notes

With the penalty-kick shootout win over Tacoma, LAÂ GalaxyÂ IIÂ improved to 2-0-2 (8 GF, 6 GA) in their last four regular-season matches played dating back to June 29.

In five penalty-kick shootouts contested during the 2023 MLS NEXT Pro campaign, LAÂ GalaxyÂ IIÂ hold a 3-2-0 record.Â

In nine matches played at home during the 2023 campaign, LA holds a 4-3-2 record.Â

In their last five home matches played dating back to May 21, LAÂ GalaxyÂ IIÂ hold an unbeaten record of 3-0-2 (10 GF, 6 GA).Â

InÂ GalaxyÂ IIâs last five matches played dating back to June 9, LA holds a record of 2-1-2.Â

In two matches played against the Tacoma Defiance this season, LAÂ GalaxyÂ IIÂ held a 0-1-1 record.Â

Jonathan PÃ©rez tallied his first goal of the 2023 campaign, created five chances and completed four dribbles in the match against the Defiance.

Aaron Bibout recorded his fifth assist of the season in the match against Tacoma. Biboutâs ranks tied for fourth in MLS NEXT Pro with five assists. Â

In his last 10 appearances dating back to May 21, Bibout has tallied six goals and four assists.Â

Adam SaldaÃ±a completed 51 of 53 passes (94.4%), won five possessions and six of 10 duels against Tacoma.

In his fourth appearance with GIIÂ this season,Â Novak MiÄoviÄ recorded three saves, including making two penalty-kick stops in the shootout win over the Defiance.Â

Five LAÂ GalaxyÂ players appeared on loan in the match against Tacoma:Â Novak MiÄoviÄ, Marcus Ferkranus,Jonathan PÃ©rez, Adam SaldaÃ±a and Gino Vivi.Â

Next Game

*Next up, LAÂ GalaxyÂ IIÂ play host to Wrexham AFC in a friendly at Dignity Health Sports Park on Saturday, July 22. The July 22 match kicks off at 7:30 p.m. PT and will be streamed live on MLS Season Pass on Apple TV.
